themes: Broadening definitions of artistic value and impact
Overemphasis on trendy or hardship-based art
Need for support of skilled, process-driven, and reflective work
Sustaining the creative foundation and arts ecosystem
key_phrases: broaden their definition of impact and artistic value
funding seems to go toward work that is loud, trendy, or tied to hardship narratives
space for skilled, process-driven, and reflective work
doesn't rely on shock value but still deeply contributes
funding that supports long-time local artists, not just emerging voices or those new to Austin
quietly building the creative foundation of this city
thoughtful investment in our continued work would strengthen the entire arts ecosystem
barriers_identified: Narrow definitions of impact and artistic value in funding decisions
Preference for trendy or hardship narrative-driven work
Lack of support for established, long-time local artists
solutions_proposed: Broaden the definition of impact and artistic value in funding criteria
Create space and funding for skilled, process-driven, and reflective work (e.g., naturalist and landscape art)
Increase funding support for long-time local artists, not just emerging or new-to-Austin artists
Invest thoughtfully in the continued work of established artists to strengthen the arts ecosystem
